page.title: 16THE CLIFF TOP TRAIL
page.content:
The Cliff Top Trail covers the picturesque area of cliffs between the Country Park and Dunbar castle. {Volcanic Features}The features have been formed from the remains of several volcanoes which were active 300 million years ago eg the Doo Rock. Erosion by the sea has created caves, arches, stacks and reefs.
{Vegetation}Man has influenced the plant life along the Trail. The only truly natural plants are those on the cliff faces.Sea Pinks, Harebells, Trefoil and Elderberry can be found.
{Wildlife}Many different types of birds can be seen here. There are gulls, waders, ducks and other surface divers, as well as many land birds.
